intro: Hieracium gravastelloides, commonly known as the Italian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium gravastelloides is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
